item.title: Filling the Gap with Commandline Integration - PhoneGap, Cordova, Grunt, Gulp
item.description: Something that has always been part of the Komodo design philosophy has been integration. Though Komodo should provide tooling to make our users more productive, it should NOT try to do EVERYTHING. Integration, not imitation, is the key [...]

item.title: First Start Wizard
item.description: If you've never run Komodo before or if this is the first time you're running a major version (eg. you were using Komodo 9.3 and have just upgraded to Komodo X), then Komodo will show you the First Start Wizard as it loads [...]

item.title: Under the Hood: Komodo X and Chrome Debugging
item.description: It is easy to take for granted Komodo IDE's superb debugging support. Komodo excels at debugging common scripting languages like Perl, Python, Tcl, and Ruby. It can also debug PHP, Node.js, and XSLT. With Komodo X [...]

item.title: Komodo Extreme Makeover
item.description: If you installed Komodo X recently and you were not one of the users who participated in the Beta release phase then when you opened Komodo you might have thought you downloaded the wrong program (Chess any one?). But you didn't [...]

item.title: 10 Komodo Features Web Developers Will Love
item.description: Komodo IDE X adds a ton of new features, many of which targeted at web developers. We realize that while not everyone may consider themselves a web developer, most developers these days will be using web technologies to some degree [...]

item.title: How We Made Komodo X Even Faster
item.description: Komodo has always been a very fast IDE. So much so that combined with its minimalistic UI many users tend to confuse Komodo IDE with an editor. Of course Komodo is an editor too, but to call it just an editor would be doing it a disservice [...]

item.title: Komodo 10.0.1 Released
item.description: We hope everyone has been enjoying Komodo X so far. Today we're releasing our first update, which is focussed entirely on stability and primarily resolves bugs introduced in 10.0.0 as well as a few longer standing issues [...]

item.title: Komodo X Webinar: Questions and Answers
item.description: On June 6, 2016 at 10 am PDT, NathanR and myself (CareyH) introduced Komodo X to the world (just under 100 people…) in a live webcast. Our goal was to show off some of the new features in action and let people ask questions about what they heard, saw [...]

item.title: Top 11 Tips and Tricks for Komodo X
item.description: I would like to start this post by thanking those of you who have mild to severe OCD and yet still clicked our provocative title. I realized while writing another blog post that we hadn’t written a Komodo Tips and Tricks post for over 3 years [...]

item.title: 5 Reasons to use an IDE Instead of an Editor
item.description: The word *editor* and IDE (integrated development environments) are often mistakenly used interchangeably. However, there are some big differences between the two. The extra functionality you get with an IDE can provide significant time savings [...]

item.title: Chrome Debugging in Komodo X, Code and Debug in One Place
item.description: Let me set the stage: You are a web developer. You spend many hours a week writing javascript, running javascript and debugging javascript. You're very adept at it, you write your code, fire up a web server and point Chrome at it [...]

item.title: Komodo X Released - It's 10X Better
item.description: The moment is finally here, Komodo X (10) is released and it's like 10 times better! The pun sounded so horrible when I came up with it, I just had to use it. But it really is a LOT better [...]

item.title: Help Us Test Komodo IDE 10 and We'll Give You $50
item.description: As you may have heard, we released our Komodo 10 alpha last week so the community can help us run it through its paces. We've already received a ton of helpful bug reports but we want MORE [...]

item.title: Komodo 10 Alpha Pre-release Now Available
item.description: Releasing an alpha/beta of your product is like showing everyone your new baby. Everyone is excited, but he's still very fragile, and you're scared someone might look at them the wrong way. Komodo 10 has come a long way [...]

item.title: Komodo Toolbox
item.description: The Komodo toolbox is where you can store all of your custom tools such as code snippets and abbreviations, userscripts, commands, etc. The fresh Komodo install comes with a huge selection of tools and snippets already installed [...]
